results.title: A high fat, sugar, and salt Western diet induces motor-muscular and sensory dysfunctions and neurodegeneration in mice during aging: Ameliorative action of metformin
results.text_hl: To explore the novel linkage between a Western diet combining high saturated fat, sugar, and salt (HFSS) and @DISEASE_Neurologic_Manifestations @DISEASE_MESH:D009461 @@@neurological dysfunctions@@@ during aging as well as @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ intervention, we assessed @<m>DISEASE_Malformations_of_Cortical_Development</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054220 @@@cerebral cortex abnormalities@@@ associated with @DISEASE_Motor_neuropathy_peripheral_with_dysautonomia @DISEASE_MESH:C536988 @@@sensory and motor dysfunctions@@@ and cellular and molecular insights in brains using HFSS-fed @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@ during aging.

citations.NLM: Hong S, Nagayach A, Lu Y, Peng H, Duong QA, Pham NB, Vuong CA, Bazan NG. A high fat, sugar, and salt Western diet induces motor-muscular and sensory dysfunctions and neurodegeneration in mice during aging: Ameliorative action of metformin CNS Neurosci Ther. 2021 Dec;27(12):1458-1471. PMID: 34510763
citations.BibTeX: @article{34510763, title={A high fat, sugar, and salt Western diet induces motor-muscular and sensory dysfunctions and neurodegeneration in mice during aging: Ameliorative action of metformin}, author={Hong S and Nagayach A and Lu Y and Peng H and Duong QA and Pham NB and Vuong CA and Bazan NG}, journal={CNS Neurosci Ther}, volume={27}, number={12}, pages={1458-1471}}

results.title: Metformin mediates neuroprotection and attenuates hearing loss in experimental pneumococcal meningitis
results.text_hl: Compared to animals receiving @CHEMICAL_Ceftriaxone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002443 @@@ceftriaxone@@@ monotherapy, adjunctive @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ significantly reduced @<m>DISEASE_Malformations_of_Cortical_Development</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D054220 @@@cortical@@@ @DISEASE_Necrosis @DISEASE_MESH:D009336 @@@necrosis@@@ (p < 0.02) during acute @DISEASE_Infections @DISEASE_MESH:D007239 @@@infection@@@ and improved median click-induced hearing thresholds (60 dB vs. 100 dB, p < 0.002) 5 weeks after @DISEASE_Infections @DISEASE_MESH:D007239 @@@infection@@@.

citations.NLM: Muri L, Le ND, Zemp J, Grandgirard D, Leib SL. Metformin mediates neuroprotection and attenuates hearing loss in experimental pneumococcal meningitis J Neuroinflammation. 2019 Jul 27;16(1):156. PMID: 31351490
citations.BibTeX: @article{31351490, title={Metformin mediates neuroprotection and attenuates hearing loss in experimental pneumococcal meningitis}, author={Muri L and Le ND and Zemp J and Grandgirard D and Leib SL}, journal={J Neuroinflammation}, volume={16}, number={1}, pages={156}}
